alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills; Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 6:10PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Multnomah, southeastern Clark and southwestern Skamania Counties through 645 PM PDT... At 609 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mill Plain, or 7 miles northwest of Washougal, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Washougal, Vancouver, Camas, Hockinson, Larch Mountain, Orchards, Mill Plain, Five Corners, Walnut Grove, Venersborg, Proebstel, Elkhorn Mountain, Vancouver Mall, Lacamas Lake, Sifton, Camp Bonneville, Evergreen, Brush Prairie and Minnehaha. This includes the following highways in Washington... Interstate 205 between mile markers 30 and 32. State Route 14 between mile markers 15 and 21. State Route 503 near mile marker 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills; Western Columbia River Gorge
